show_overview.title: India's Got Latent
show_overview.description: India's Got Latent is a Hindi-language digital entertainment show launched on June 14, 2024. Created and hosted by comedian Samay Raina, the show blends humor, talent discovery, and satire into a unique parody of traditional talent competitions. The word 'Latent' emphasizes discovering hidden abilities of contestants in a fun and unpredictable environment.
show_overview.format: The show follows a quirky talent-show format. Contestants predict their own scores before performing. Judges score their performance, and if the predicted score matches the average judge score, the contestant is declared a 'Latent Winner.' This concept highlights self-awareness and adds comedic unpredictability.
show_overview.inspiration: The show draws its inspiration from 'Kill Tony' (a US-based live comedy show) and India's Got Talent. However, it differentiates itself through improvisational humor, meme-driven culture, and satirical takes on talent evaluation.
show_overview.platform: India's Got Latent was streamed on YouTube and filmed at The Habitat, Mumbai. All episodes were made private in February 2025 following backlash and legal controversies.
show_overview.judges_summary: Each episode featured a different panel of celebrity judges — comedians, musicians, actors, and influencers — including Raftaar, Badshah, Sumukhi Suresh, Aishwarya Mohanraj, Anubhav Singh Bassi, Atul Khatri, Kusha Kapila, and more.
show_overview.audience_engagement: The show exploded on Indian meme pages and YouTube comment sections. Contestant moments went viral, triggering debates, parody reels, and cultural trends online.
show_overview.memes_and_virality: Popular clips — like Kunal Kamra’s savage judge moments, awkward contestant reactions, and unfiltered jokes — made it a viral phenomenon. The internet loved the unpredictability and relatability of its raw moments.

recent_controversies.incident: Ranveer Allahbadia's Controversial Remark in Bonus Episode 6
recent_controversies.details: On February 10, 2025, during Bonus Episode 6 of India's Got Latent, guest judge Ranveer Allahbadia (BeerBiceps) asked a contestant: 'Would you rather watch your parents have sex every day for the rest of your life or join in once to make it stop forever?' This provoked massive outrage across social media, with viewers calling the remark obscene and inappropriate. Legal complaints were filed in Maharashtra and Assam. A parliamentary committee even raised concerns about content regulation for YouTube shows and podcasts.
recent_controversies.current_status: The Supreme Court criticized the comment as 'condemnable' and restricted Allahbadia’s travel rights. Samay Raina removed all episodes of the show from YouTube. Other guests like Apoorva Mukhija received threats and backlash. The show remains unavailable and under public scrutiny. The incident sparked a wider debate on digital censorship and creator responsibility.

recent_controversies.details: Contestant Banti Banerjee made a joke referencing Deepika Padukone’s mental health. Many viewers and mental health activists criticized it as insensitive and triggering. The issue sparked conversations about the responsibility of creators to respect mental health boundaries.
recent_controversies.current_status: The joke was removed from public clips. The showrunners issued a public apology and promised greater content moderation in the future.

show_overview.current_status: The show has not resumed after February 2025. All content is currently unavailable online. No formal cancellation was announced, but there have been no updates from Samay Raina or the production team regarding a future season.

highlight_chunks.title: Best Contestants of India’s Got Latent

content.name: Naman Arora
content.description: Naman impressed with his comedic storytelling and original approach to observational humor. He gained a loyal fanbase after his performance.

content.name: Kushal Bhanushali
content.description: Kushal, a visually impaired comedian, delivered one of the most inspiring and hilarious sets. His performance was both moving and memorable, leading to several podcast features.

content.name: Bhavya Shah
content.description: Bhavya, also visually impaired, stunned audiences with his sharp wit and fearless delivery. He received praise online and from judges.

content.name: Keshav Jha
content.description: Keshav’s poetic shayari brought calm energy and depth to his episode. His act was among the most original of the season.

content.name: Khushi Saini
content.description: Khushi stood out with a high-energy rap performance and strong personality. Her online presence grew rapidly after the show.

Info.Bio: Samay RAINA is the host of INDIA'S GOT LATENT.An Indian stand-up comedian, YouTuber, and chess enthusiast, Samay Raina gained prominence as the co-winner of the second season of the stand-up comedy contest Comicstaan. During the COVID-19 pandemic, he began streaming chess games on his YouTube channel, collaborating with comedians and chess masters. His efforts have significantly contributed to popularizing chess in India.

Balraj Singh Ghai is an entrepreneur and stand-up comedian based in Mumbai. He is the founder of The Habitat, a restaurant and performance venue that has become a hub for artists and performers. Balraj has also been involved in various television projects, including Aalas Motaapa Ghabraahat (2021) and Shut Up Ya Kunal (2017).
Info.Appearance: Appeared in all main episodes and Bonus Episodes 2, 3, and 4, but not in Episode 11,8 Bonus Episode 1.

Info.Bio: Raftaar, born Dilin Nair, is an acclaimed Indian rapper, music producer, and television personality. Known for his energetic performances and chart-topping hits, he has been a significant figure in the Indian music industry. Raftaar has also appeared as a judge on various reality shows, showcasing his versatility and influence in the entertainment industry.

Sahil Kale is an up-and-coming stand-up comedian known for his observational humor. He has been part of the comedy scene in India, performing at various venues and events. Sahil's unique style and relatable content have garnered attention, making him a notable figure among emerging comedians.
Info.Appearance: Appeared in Episode 1 and Bonus Episode 1.

Info.Bio: Neeti Palta is an Indian stand-up comedian, writer, and former advertising professional known for her sharp wit and relatable humor. She was one of the first female comedians to make a mark in India's comedy scene, blending observational comedy with cultural insights. Neeti has performed globally, appeared on Amazon Prime Video's Comedy Specials, and gained popularity for her take on gender, family, and societal norms. Before comedy, she wrote for the TV show Galli Galli Sim Sim (India’s version of Sesame Street).

Maheep Singh is a stand-up comedian known for his observational humor and relatable content. He has been active in the Indian comedy circuit, performing at various events and shows. Maheep's ability to connect with audiences through his witty and humorous takes on everyday life has made him a popular figure in the comedy scene.

Saurabh Pandey is a poet, storyteller, and actor with a heartfelt narrative style. He has been involved in various performances and events, captivating audiences with his storytelling prowess. Saurabh's contributions to the arts have been recognized, and he continues to be an influential figure in the Indian entertainment industry.

Vivek Desai is a multi-talented performer and mentor in the arts. He has been associated with various projects, showcasing his versatility and passion for the arts. Vivek's guidance and mentorship have been instrumental in shaping the careers of many artists, making him a respected figure in the industry.

Vidit Gujrathi is a renowned Indian chess grandmaster and streamer. He has been instrumental in popularizing chess in India through his online streams and collaborations. Vidit's expertise and contributions to the chess community have been widely recognized, earning him accolades and a significant following.

Poonam Pandey is an Indian model, actress, and social media influencer. She gained fame through her bold and controversial statements and has been a part of various reality shows. Poonam's presence in the entertainment industry continues to be significant, with her active engagement on social media platforms.

Aggu Stanley is a choreographer and performer known for his dynamic dance performances. He has been part of various dance reality shows and events, showcasing his talent and creativity. Aggu's contributions to the dance industry have been recognized, and he continues to inspire with his performances.

Deepak Kalal is a social media personality known for his humorous content. He gained popularity through his comedic videos and has been a part of various reality shows. Deepak's unique style and approach to comedy have made him a notable figure in the entertainment industry.

Manan Desai is a comedian and co-founder of The Comedy Factory. He has been active in the comedy scene, performing at various events and shows. Manan's contributions to the comedy industry have been significant, and he continues to entertain audiences with his wit and humor.

Raghu Ram is a TV producer and judge known for MTV's Roadies. He has been a significant figure in the Indian television industry, known for his candid and straightforward approach. Raghu's influence in the entertainment industry continues to be profound, with his active participation in various projects.

Sidwarrier is a neuroscientist and educator blending science and entertainment. He has been involved in various projects that aim to make science accessible and entertaining. Sidwarrier's unique approach to education and entertainment has garnered attention and appreciation.

Amin is a magician and entertainer with dynamic performances. He has been part of various events and shows, captivating audiences with his magical acts. Amin's contributions to the entertainment industry have been recognized, and he continues to mesmerize with his performances.

Bappa is a judge and mentor in theatrical performances. He has been associated with various projects, guiding and mentoring artists in their performances. Bappa's expertise and mentorship have been instrumental in shaping the careers of many artists.

Badshah, whose real name is Aditya Prateek Singh Sisodia, is one of India's most celebrated rappers, music producers, and lyricists. Known for redefining the Indian music scene, he has produced chart-topping hits such as "DJ Waley Babu," "Kar Gayi Chull," and "Genda Phool." Badshah seamlessly blends Bollywood rhythms with urban hip-hop influences, making his music universally appealing. As a mentor and judge on talent shows like India's Got Talent and Dil Hai Hindustani, he has inspired and guided emerging artists. His unique style, commercial success, and entrepreneurial ventures have established him as a cultural icon in India. He appeared in Bonus Episode 2.

Siddhant Chaturvedi is a Bollywood actor who gained fame for his breakout role as MC Sher in the critically acclaimed film Gully Boy. Known for his charm and acting versatility, Siddhant has continued to make his mark in the industry with roles in projects like Gehraiyaan and Bunty Aur Babli 2. His journey from modeling to mainstream cinema highlights his dedication to his craft.

Gursimran Khamba is a comedian, writer, and co-founder of the comedy collective All India Bakchod (AIB). Known for his sharp wit and satire, he played a pivotal role in redefining comedy in India through live performances and online sketches. Khamba has also contributed as a writer for various shows and events, solidifying his place in the Indian comedy scene.

Avika Gor is an Indian television and film actress best known for her role as Anandi in the iconic TV serial Balika Vadhu. She has received numerous awards for her performances and has also ventured into films across regional industries. Avika continues to be a beloved figure in Indian entertainment.

Devesh Dixit is a stand-up comedian known for his laid-back style and sarcastic humor. With performances across major comedy venues and online platforms, he has earned a reputation for his observational comedy and unique take on everyday scenarios. His relatable and witty humor resonates widely with audiences.

Shashwat Maheshwari is a stand-up comedian and writer renowned for his clean comedy and musical parodies. His ability to blend humor with music has set him apart in the Indian comedy circuit. Shashwat's performances are marked by clever writing and a creative approach to entertainment.

GamerFleet, whose real name is Anshu Bisht, is a popular Indian gaming content creator and YouTuber. Known for his engaging personality, he streams a variety of games, including Minecraft and GTA V. His rise in the gaming community has made him one of the prominent figures in India's streaming landscape.

Nishant Tanwar, also known as 'Joke Singh,' is a seasoned stand-up comedian celebrated for his relatable humor and storytelling. His content often draws from his personal experiences and societal observations, connecting with audiences across diverse demographics.

Karan Singh is a renowned mentalist and illusionist who has been captivating audiences with his mind-reading and magic acts. With performances across the globe, he has established himself as a leading figure in modern-day magic in India. His ability to merge psychological principles with entertainment makes his shows unforgettable.

Uorfi Javed is a television actress and social media personality known for her unique fashion sense and bold public persona. She gained attention for her stint in reality shows like Bigg Boss OTT and has since remained a trending figure in the entertainment world.

Aashish Solanki is a rising star in the stand-up comedy scene, known for his sharp wit and observational humor. With appearances on several comedy platforms, Aashish has steadily built a reputation as a promising comedian with a fresh perspective.

Yashraj Mehra is an Indian rapper, singer, and songwriter known for his work in the Indian hip-hop and rap music scene. He gained recognition for his distinctive style, which blends elements of storytelling with contemporary rap, often touching on themes of youth culture, social issues, and personal experiences. Yashraj's lyrics are known for being impactful, and he often addresses real-life struggles, making his music resonate with a wide audience.He is also known for his appearances on various comedy shows, which helped him build a presence in the entertainment industry. His work includes not only performances but also collaborations with other musicians and artists in the Indian rap scene.

Amit Tandon, often referred to as "The Married Guy," is one of India's most popular stand-up comedians. His content, largely centered around family life and relationships, resonates with audiences of all ages. Amit has performed internationally, further establishing his comedic credentials.

Kunal Kamra is a stand-up comedian known for his political satire and fearless approach to addressing sensitive topics. His comedy often critiques social and political systems, making him a polarizing yet significant figure in the Indian comedy landscape.

Atul Khatri is a veteran comedian who transitioned from being a businessman to a successful stand-up performer. He has performed on global stages, including Netflix specials, and is recognized for his relatable and witty humor.
Vipul Goyal is an accomplished comedian and the star of the popular web series Humorously Yours. His observational humor and charming delivery have made him a favorite among Indian audiences.

Sonali Thakker is a stand-up comedian and writer known for her fresh take on everyday issues. With performances at comedy festivals and online platforms, she is celebrated for her engaging stage presence and relatable humor.

real name kumar gurjar popularly known as Rahgir, is a poet, singer-songwriter, and storyteller whose work reflects themes of love, life, and human emotions. His unique blend of poetry and music has earned him a loyal following.

Ravi Gupta is a comedian and performer known for his storytelling style and humorous takes on life. His performances often blend satire with anecdotes, making him a relatable figure in the comedy space.
Sagar is a content creator and performer who combines humor and commentary in his work. He has been involved in various projects, including comedy sketches and collaborations.

Calm, whose real name is Siddhant Sharma, is a member of the rap duo Seedhe Maut. Known for his dynamic rap style and lyrical prowess, he has been instrumental in shaping India's independent music scene. Calm's work explores themes of personal struggles, social issues, and urban life.

Encore ABJ, born Abhijay Negi, is a prominent rapper and lyricist, and a member of the rap duo Seedhe Maut. Renowned for his powerful lyrics and captivating stage presence, ABJ delves into diverse themes such as identity, resilience, and the Indian experience in his music.

Madhur Virli is a stand-up comedian known for his relatable and humorous storytelling. He gained prominence for his comedy special, The IIT Dream, where he reflects on the pressures of pursuing engineering, the intense coaching culture, and his journey through college life. With a unique blend of humor and relatability, Madhur addresses common societal expectations and delivers motivational undertones through his performances

Kaustubh Agarwal is a rising talent in the Indian stand-up comedy scene. Known for his witty observations and sharp humor, Kaustubh frequently performs at major comedy clubs and events across India. His sets often highlight relatable, everyday situations infused with clever wordplay and satire

Bharti Singh is one of India’s most popular comedians and television personalities. She gained fame with her performances in comedy shows like Comedy Circus, The Kapil Sharma Show, and India's Best Dancer. Known for her impeccable comic timing, infectious laughter, and larger-than-life persona, Bharti is loved by audiences of all ages. Her humor often touches upon everyday situations, and she is celebrated for her versatility in both stand-up comedy and hosting roles.

Harsh Limbachiya is an Indian writer, comedian, and television producer. He is best known for his work as a writer on The Kapil Sharma Show. Harsh has a sharp wit and often blends humor with satire, drawing from personal experiences and social observations. His creative contributions to comedy have earned him a fan following, and he is often seen alongside his wife Bharti Singh in various comedic shows and segments.

Tony Kakkar is an Indian playback singer, music composer, and lyricist. Known for his energetic and catchy songs, Tony has become one of the most popular voices in the Indian music industry. His hits include songs like Coca Cola Tu, Dheeme Dheeme, and Mile Ho Tum. Tony is also known for his collaborations with other famous artists in the music industry, contributing to both Bollywood and independent music scenes.

Tanmay Bhat is a renowned Indian comedian, writer, and content creator. He gained fame as a co-founder of All India Bakchod (AIB), a popular comedy collective known for its sketches, stand-up shows, and innovative digital content. Tanmay is also a prominent figure in the Indian YouTube scene, hosting engaging conversations, streaming games, and creating thought-provoking and humorous content.

Arpit Bala is an emerging comedian and performer with a knack for entertaining audiences through his humorous narratives and engaging stage presence. He continues to make his mark in the comedy circuit.

Another contestant who was performing poetry in hindi but wasn't remembering it correctly he would start again and again and people make gun of him upon asking more about what he does he works in a Cyber security company as operation assistant and Aashish Solanki replied he would always click on forget password in romanized hindi ( ye pata h kia krta hoga ye baar baar forgot password dabata hoga) and everyone laughed...

Another contestant who originally was rapping and then said he was acting to rap and actually he does acting upon asking what he does he said he has fone BBA and is controlling his father's business and then also said I'm kind of acting there too and when the judges scored him and it wasn't near to his prediction samay said in romanized hindi ( tujhe kia laga hm bi acting karain ge) meaning what did you thought we would also be acting to score you better here and everyone laughed

Probably the best performance of the episode was the contestant (Suryansh Tiwary) who did mimicry of Salman Khan and copied his style which went soo viral over the internet like he literally copied Salman Khan's style and like said in romanized hindi and some moments were like  he introduced every judge on the panel with wrong names like first  at balraj and said Random as Lassi drinker For Samay raina as Samay Rihana and uorfi Javed as Murgi javed and literally everyone was laughing soo much on his performance the best of the episode then  in Salman Khan's style ( Aa jaon apni pay) in angry style when he was introducing the judges as in his performance and and then pointed at Solanki when he interrupted him

And then he behaved as a host and said that audience has questions for the judges and first question was for Samay and he said in romanized hindi " sex k pehle hilana chahie ya baad ma" everyone laughing soo much and samay replied before so he get better timing

At the end in the last contestants performance when the first poetry guy who was won the judges asked him to rate him and it was equal to the last judge's prediction so before there was only one winner and the prize was only his and now after he scored the last person himself and he won so the prize was split

Naman Arora who did acting and poetry and is a mix of everything and is just pure comedy and everybody loved his performance he was the hest performer in the Whole Show and like even samay invited him to open his show and like his performance was the best even he won the SHOW in that episode too he was best Truly the best Find of the show

And he said that his friend can't speak properly and he himself demonstrates that's how he communicates with his friend and then judges ask hiw will you talk with someone who can't speak properly then he demonstrates in the style of someone with disabilities of walking and everyone laughed and then samay asked him you are so like racist to people with disabilities how will you face them after this show he said i will run fast as they will not be able to catch up with me and everyone laughed

Another contestant Banti Banerjee she was telling that she became a mother 2 years ago and that's bery challenging for her and like then she said Deepika Padukone also became a mother Recently now she knows what depression looks like and everyone laughed context is
Bollywood actor Deepika Padukone has spoken publicly about her experience with depression, and has shared her journey to recovery and the importance of mental health awareness:
Symptoms: Padukone described feeling empty, directionless, and having a sense of confusion. She also experienced physical symptoms, such as shallow and uneven breathing.
Diagnosis: Padukone was diagnosed with depression in 2014.
Treatment: She went to counseling and took medication.
Recovery: Padukone has said that she felt liberated after accepting and speaking about her depression. She has stopped taking medication and hopes to help others by sharing her story.
Awareness: Padukone has said that she wants to help reduce the stigma and lack of awareness around mental illness. She is working on an initiative to raise awareness and help people.

At the start of the show, when Samay was introducing judges and Rakhi Sawant came at the end, she said, 'Sorry guys, I got late because Maheep Singh ran away with my undergarments.' Everyone in the crowd went buzzing, with an electrifying atmosphere full of laughter. Maheep Singh replied, 'Wapas bhi toh kar diye thay dhooke' (meaning 'I returned them after washing them'). Everyone went crazy laughing at this moment.
Samay introduced Yashraj and said he is like Rakhi Sawant's lips because he’s just a filler. The crowd laughed a lot at this comparison.

Samay asked Rakhi Sawant about Mika Singh (referring to the infamous birthday party kiss). She replied, 'It's been 15 years, why are you still thinking about him?' and then added, 'Oh yeah, you didn't get to play with the lips like me, that's why you're saying this.' Everyone shouted for Rakhi to kiss Samay. Amidst the chaos, Rakhi kissed Samay, and the crowd went crazy.

Rakhi pointed at Maheep Singh and asked, 'Who’s this old man?' Samay replied, 'You must have forgotten—it’s been 15 years... he’s Mika Singh.' Everyone laughed as Rakhi retorted, 'Mika Singh was so hot, but this one is cold as ice.'

Rakhi Sawant started eating something. Samay asked, 'What are you eating?' She replied, 'Viagra for controlling Maheep Singh.' Someone shouted, 'Viagra toh lund ke liye hota hai?' Rakhi replied, 'Yeh lund hi toh hai' (Viagra is for a dick? She replied, 'Yes, he’s a dick'). This moment went viral across the internet.

A contestant mentioned he lives in the mountains. Samay asked if he ever feels cold. Rakhi said, 'Why would he feel cold? I am here!' Maheep Singh replied, 'No, no, he must feel cold.' Rakhi replied, 'At this age, he would feel it like that,' adding in Hindi, 'Inki teenon taangen is waqt qabar mein hain' (His three legs are in the grave right now). She then said, 'But I can pull all three legs out of the grave,' leaving everyone laughing hysterically.

Samay asked Rakhi Sawant which type of men she likes. Maheep Singh interjected, 'Don’t take my name.' Rakhi replied, 'Gaarh ke aao yaar isse' (Go and bury him). Everyone laughed hysterically at this comment.

A contestant performing mimicry imitated a dog's voice. Rakhi commented, 'Samay is also like this.' Samay replied, 'Koi ni Rakhi ji, aapko baad mein dikhata hoon Doggy style' (No worries, Rakhi, I’ll show you Doggy style later). Everyone laughed so hard at this moment.

There was consistent banter throughout the episode between Rakhi Sawant and Maheep Singh, where they toasted each other. Maheep often flirted with Rakhi, leading to hilarious exchanges and audience laughter.

The last contestant, Khushi Saini, performed a rap that was incredibly talented and admired by everyone. Her performance went viral on the internet, receiving significant engagement. She won the episode and was considered the best performer of the show.

Samay introduced the judges and mentioned Rohan Joshi and Sahil Shah, calling them from 'two broken collectives.' Rohan Joshi replied, 'Shut the fuck up, you man from broken state.' Everyone laughed, understanding the context related to Samay being from Kashmir and the ongoing war situation.
Samay asked the Colucol artist if he had a job, to which the contestant confirmed. Samay humorously said, 'Good, never leave that job,' and the audience laughed.

A magician performed a card trick where Samay was asked to pick a card. After a series of tricks, it was revealed that the card Samay picked wasn't the same as the one shown on the T-shirt. The magician then humorously explained it was Samay who messed up, but eventually revealed the trick worked and left everyone amazed.

A contestant performing Urdu Poetry was nervous, and when Samay asked about it, he responded that he had smoked a bit. Samay jokingly misunderstood him, thinking he said 'weed' instead of 'BA,' causing everyone to laugh.
When the Urdu Poetry contestant was asked about the meaning of his poetry, he replied with a dim voice, 'Fuck her bro.' Samay responded, 'Shot nahi, short ma samjha,' causing an uproar of laughter.

When the contestant's form revealed his goal in life was to earn enough money to produce a show like 'INDIA'S GOT LATENT' and get better judges, Samay joked, 'That's my goal too, bhai!' Everyone laughed hysterically, and it went viral.

The contestant's superpower choice was 'Reading people's minds' because he overthinks. Samay pointed at Amin Khan (the bodyguard) and asked, 'Tell me what Andrew Tate is thinking?' The contestant joked, 'He just wants me to get off the stage now.' The bodyguard confirmed, 'Yeah,' which left everyone in splits.

A musical band took a long time setting up their mics and Samay joked, 'Tomorrow there will be two AirPods born from this mic.' This was in reference to a previous joke by Alban Choonawala, and it had the audience laughing.
Samay joked with the band member who wrote 'We move on quickly...' in his form after taking so long to start. The band member replied, 'Okay, next question,' and the audience burst into laughter.
Poshak Dua, the magician, called Sahil Shah on stage to block his ears, and Samay joked, 'Like the audience in your shows, Sahil Bhai,' causing the audience to laugh.

Poshak Dua performed a magic trick, inserting a nail in his nose, and humorously warned the audience not to try it at home. Sahil Shah replied, 'No adult watches Samay's channel,' which was a savage comeback.
Poshak Dua predicted his score before performing and correctly guessed a 9. When the result matched, everyone in the audience went wild, acknowledging his magic skills.

faq_answers.question: What is India's Got Latent?
faq_answers.answer: India's Got Latent is a digital parody of talent shows, featuring comedians and creators performing or showcasing random, sometimes absurd talents. It's more about humor and vibe than actual talent.

faq_answers.question: Who created the show?
faq_answers.answer: The show was created by stand-up comedian Samay Raina, known for his live streams and comedic content. He also hosted every episode along with recurring appearances by Vaibhav Sethia and Balraj.

faq_answers.question: How many episodes were there?
faq_answers.answer: There were 12 full episodes and 6 bonus episodes, streamed between June 2024 and February 2025.

faq_answers.question: Why was the show taken down?
faq_answers.answer: The show was taken down after a controversy involving podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia. His inappropriate joke towards a contestant received massive backlash and triggered legal and political escalation.

faq_answers.question: Where can I watch the episodes now?
faq_answers.answer: As of now, all episodes have been set to private on YouTube. There is no legal or official source to view them.

faq_answers.question: What was the show's format?
faq_answers.answer: Contestants predicted their scores before performing. If the judges’ average score matched the prediction, the contestant won. This twist made things funnier and less about talent, more about chaotic fun.

faq_answers.question: Who were the judges?
faq_answers.answer: The judges changed every episode. They included big names like Raftaar, Badshah, Kusha Kapila, Anubhav Singh Bassi, Aishwarya Mohanraj, Atul Khatri, and others.

faq_answers.question: Will the show return?
faq_answers.answer: There’s no official announcement. The creators have remained silent since the controversy. Speculations suggest it may return in a rebranded format or on a different platform.

faq_answers.question: Was the show scripted or real?
faq_answers.answer: The show was semi-scripted. Some segments were planned, especially with recurring jokes and characters, but most interactions were spontaneous and relied on judge chemistry and contestant unpredictability.
